author: Saleen Martin
title: 'May this keep you safe from harm': WWII era Bible returned to New York veteran's family
text: Lost Bible returned to slain USAAF airman from World War II [Saleen Martin](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7245115001/saleen-martin/) During World War II, a woman bought three brothers Bibles to protect their hearts and guide them as they set out for battle. The Bible had a metal cover on the front with the inscription ‚ÄúMay this keep you safe from harm." Two of the brothers made it home, while the other, Lt. Edsel J. McKnight of the United States Army Air Forces, was shot down off the coast of France. His Bible was mailed to the family but was lost sometime after. This month, his family finally got it back. Ava Coogan's family is from Albany, New York and they found the Bible in late December while going through their late matriarch‚Äôs belongings. On Jan. 11, Coogan met Lt. McKnight‚Äôs sister-in-law and returned the Bible to her, allowing her to put it back in its rightful place, next to the ones his brothers brought back home from war. ‚ÄòI kept playing with it and flipping through the pages‚Äô Coogan‚Äôs uncle and mother found the Bible in a stack of books. Their mother, Rosanne Vartanian, died nearly 20 years ago but was a collector and loved garage sales. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just so random that my grandmother had the urge to pick that up,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúShe bought random things. There was no rhyme or reason to it. It was with a stack of other books.‚Äù Coogan decided to research the Bible and found out soldiers often took them to war. Some can be found in museums. ‚ÄúThe whole premise of it was that the metal cover on the front is like a hard shield,‚Äù Coogan told USA TODAY. ‚ÄúThey would put it in their coat pockets ‚Ä¶ like the front breast pocket ‚Ä¶ that cover would protect their heart from bullets.‚Äù Lt. McKnight‚Äôs name was also written in the Bible, said Coogan, who was drawn to the Bible for some reason. She couldn‚Äôt put it down, she recalled. ‚ÄúI kept playing with it and flipping through the pages,‚Äù she said. She noticed that the Bible‚Äôs front cover had a slice in it, almost like something was underneath it. She examined it more closely and found a piece of paper folded up inside. She asked her uncle for help, who carefully used a butter knife to get the slip of paper out. Once they retrieved the piece of paper from under the Bible‚Äôs cover, they saw that it was a plea for the Bible‚Äôs safe return to an address not too far away. Although there was no area code, there was a phone number listed, so the family added their own area code and called. ‚ÄúI was just hoping for the best,‚Äù Coogan said. ‚ÄúWe found out that number worked.‚Äù Lieutenant was shot down off the coast of France When Coogan called the number written in the note, she spoke to a woman named Fay, Lt. McKnight‚Äôs sister-in-law. They organized a meetup on Jan. 11 to return the Bible to the family, who is from Porter Corners, part of Saratoga County in eastern New York. Lt. McKnight served in the U.S. Air Force‚Äôs 365th Fighter Group and 388th Fighter Squadron. He was flying in a Thunderbolt fighter aircraft in 1944 when he was shot down off the coast of France, [online records](https://rafbeaulieu.co.uk/honouring-the-airmen-of-raf-beaulieu/) show. Fay told Coogan and her family that Lt. McKnight has two brothers. All three of the brothers served in WWII. Fay‚Äôs husband, Ray, said his Bible saved his life. ‚ÄúHe got shot during the war and it hit where the Bible was, covering his heart, and the bullet went into his arm instead,‚Äù Coogan said. Once Lt. McKnight was killed, his belongings were shipped back home to the family. His sister-in-law had all three Bibles on a bookshelf on display. One day, the family was preparing to go to church. Her nephew borrowed the Bible, but knew it was so precious, the family decided to write a note with contact information in case it were ever lost. ‚ÄúHe didn't lose it,‚Äù Coogan said. ‚ÄúHe brought it back after church and I guess what happened is after someone passed in their family, they had an estate sale ‚Ä¶ and it just accidentally went out with a stack of books.‚Äù It ended up in Coogan‚Äôs grandmother‚Äôs hands, she said. Returning the Bible to the McKnight family was quite the enlightening experience, Coogan said. ‚ÄúThat was really cool because that's when we kind of got to hear their story,‚Äù she said.

author: Lorenzo Reyna
title: Derrick Henry Provides Emotional Farewell to Titans Fans ‚Äì ‚ÄúI Hope I Was an Inspiration to All the Young Kids‚Äù
text:
The
Tennessee Titans became a part of two endings on Sunday in Week 18.
The first one involved ending the Jacksonville Jaguars‚Äô pursuit of the AFC South title and playoff berth, knocking off their AFC South rivals 28-20. But the second ending they became a part of? The Derrick Henry era.
Derrick Henry Delivers Emotional Postgame Speech at Nissan Stadium
Sunday‚Äôs win likely marked the final game for star running back Derrick Henry in a Titans uniform.
Henry, the powerful locomotive who won two league rushing titles and surpassed 2,000 yards back in 2020, is an unrestricted free agent for the 2024 offseason. And he looked like his old self against his longtime rivals by racking up 153 yards and a touchdown.
The 30-year-old gave the Titans fan base one last dominating rushing output for the 2023 season. But then he took the microphone to give his fans one more lasting memory ‚Äî a goodbye.
‚ÄúTitan fans, I want to say thank you for the greatest eight years of my life,‚Äù Henry began. ‚ÄúThe ups and the downs, y‚Äôall have been there through everything from the adversity and watching me grind as a person and a player. You always supported me. I love y‚Äôall. I love seeing the 22s in the stadium.‚Äù
Henry hoped he left a lasting impact on Nashville, particularly the youth.
‚ÄúI hope I was an inspiration to all the young kids and everybody in the community. I respect y‚Äôall so much,‚Äù Henry said.
He ended his speech with two words: ‚ÄúTitans up.‚Äù Then, he jogged off the field and was showered with ‚ÄúHenry!‚Äù chants as he took what is likely his final trip through the Nissan Stadium tunnel.
"
[@Titans]fans‚Ä¶ Thank you for the greatest 8 years of my life." üëëüíô [@KingHenry_2] [pic.twitter.com/3CpEHq4PiC]
‚Äî NFL (@NFL)
[January 7, 2024]
DeAndre Hopkins Offers Reaction to Henry‚Äôs Speech and Titans Career
Again, it‚Äôs likely the veteran running back and the Titans are trekking toward a mutual separation.
For De‚ÄôAndre Hopkins, he won‚Äôt get the chance to share the same Titans locker room with ‚ÄúKing Henry‚Äù in 2024. The longtime rival of Tennessee from his Houston Texans days joined Henry and the Titans immediately before the season as a free agent.
Still, the four-time Pro Bowl wide receiver told reporters he was honored to be impacted by the presence of Henry.
‚ÄúDerrick is going to get that standing ovation no matter what kind of game he had. To me, it‚Äôs a dream come true to play with a guy who‚Äôs going to be in the NFL Hall of Fame and plays the way he plays,‚Äù Hopkins told reporters in the locker room. ‚ÄúEspecially for 8-9 years. I don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs going to stop anytime soon.‚Äù
Hopkins added he knew Henry before they became NFL teammates as they‚Äôve worked out before. He added Henry didn‚Äôt think he‚Äôd come over to the Titans.
Still, the two men paired together. For Hopkins, the presence of Henry fulfills one of his hopes for his own career.
MORE:
2024 NFL Free Agents by Position
‚ÄúI always hoped to play with a great running back,‚Äù Hopkins said. ‚ÄúEspecially this late in my career. I can handle the load, but it definitely helps to have a running back to make things easier on the outside.‚Äù
DeAndre Hopkins on Derrick Henry. Says it was a dream come true playing with a future HOF running back.
[#Titans] [pic.twitter.com/Rco6HSnKPn]
‚Äî AtoZ Sports Nashville (@AtoZSports)
[January 7, 2024]
Hopkins ended up being a part of Henry‚Äôs final run as a Titan. And for Henry, he gave closure to a dominating run from 2016 to now.

author: Sharon Zhang
title: Israel Sends 88 Unidentifiable Bodies of Palestinians to Gaza in a Container | Truthout
text:
Israel Palestinian Prisoner Solidarity Activists Face Sanctions and Deportation Israel Leaks Show Israel May Be Planning to Illegally Attack Nuclear Sites in Iran Emissions World Bank Thwarts Climate Goals With $750 Million in Factory Farm Investments Reproductive Rights Biden Administration Proposes Historic Expansion of ACA‚Äôs Contraception Coverage More About Donate Manage Your Donation More Ways to Give Subscribe Submission Guidelines Financial Information Privacy Policy Memorial Essay Prize Truthout Center for Grassroots Journalism Media Against Apartheid and Displacement Job Openings Contact Us ¬© 2024 Truthout News | Human Rights Israel Sends 88 Unidentifiable Bodies of Palestinians to Gaza in a Container The Israeli military returned the Palestinians‚Äô bodies with no identification or information about their deaths.
By Sharon Zhang , T ruthout Published September 26, 2024 People stand next to a truck carrying 88 bodies, which according to the Palestinian health ministry entered the Gaza Strip from Israel the day before, as it awaits for the bodies to be unloaded and buried in a mass grave in Khan Yunis on September 26, 2024. Bashar Taleb / AFP via Getty Images On Wednesday, Israeli forces sent a shipping container to Gaza that contained bodies of 88 Palestinians that were decomposed to the point that they were unidentifiable, sparking horror over Israel‚Äôs treatment of Palestinians even after death.
Israel delivered the Palestinians‚Äô bodies in a large yellow container loaded on a truck, with no identification or information about how, when or where the people were killed.
The Gaza Health Ministry rejected the shipment, saying in a statement that officials told Israeli authorities that they would not carry on with procedures to collect the bodies until Israel returned with the names and times of death of the Palestinians, as well as the locations they were abducted from. Palestinian officials decried the shipment as an ‚Äúinhumane and criminal move.‚Äù
Not only did the Israeli military not provide any information about the Palestinians, it also seemingly allowed the bodies to rot before trying to return them to Gaza. According to Al Jazeera reporter Tareq Abu Azzoum, ‚Äúthe bodies are unidentifiable because they are mostly decomposed.‚Äù
Gaza health officials have set up a committee with ‚Äúall relevant parties‚Äù to handle the bodies.
Related Story News | Human Rights UNRWA: Israel Denying Visas to Aid Groups, ‚ÄúPhasing Out‚Äù Humanitarians in Gaza UNRWA‚Äôs head has warned that Israel is seeking to strip Palestinians of their refugee status by attacking the agency. By Sharon Zhang , T ruthout September 17, 2024 Truthout Israel has abducted thousands of Palestinians from Gaza and the occupied West Bank over the past year. Many of these people were imprisoned in Israel‚Äôs torture camps, where they were subject to horrific conditions like beatings, food and water deprivation , and sexual assault . The number of Palestinians the Israeli military has killed in these camps is unclear, but the UN reported in July that it knows of at least 53 deaths in Israeli custody since October. A UN expert reported this week that a third Palestinian doctor has died in an Israeli torture camp.
The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) noted that it was not involved in the transfer of the bodies, but said that ‚Äúall families have the right to receive news about their loved ones and bury them respectfully and in line with their traditions.‚Äù The group also noted that it is a violation of international law to mishandle dead bodies.
Euro-Med Human Rights Monitor called for an immediate international investigation into the shipment, saying that Israel has likely violated international humanitarian law in its desecration of the Palestinians‚Äô bodies.
‚ÄúThe ‚Äòcontainer‚Äô holding the dead bodies was left in one of Khan Yunis‚Äôs streets. This is a grave violation of the rights of the dead people and their families, as well as a catastrophic situation that could result in a health catastrophe,‚Äù the group said.
Israel has delivered the bodies of Palestinian people in this way multiple times amid its genocide. This past August, Israeli forces delivered the unidentified bodies of over 80 Palestinians in a container.
Palestinian officials noted that it was unclear whether the bodies were people who had been abducted by Israeli forces or if the bodies had been exhumed from their graves by the Israeli military . Officials said that Israeli forces have stolen 2,000 dead bodies from Palestinian cemeteries since October.
Israel has a long history of maiming Palestinians‚Äô bodies after death. Last week, video circulated of Israeli forces pushing dead bodies off a rooftop amid a raid in the occupied West Bank.

author: Mirage News
title: Crane name raises smiles at new Mater hospital | Mirage News
text: When schoolchildren were asked to name a construction crane on the site of a new Mater hospital, little Leticia Salas had the perfect answer ‚Äì Doctor Crane. The six-year-old's suggestion has now been chosen as the crane's official name after judges decided Leticia's was the best entry from around 300 students who took part in Mater's 'Name the Crane' competition. Dr Crane is supporting John Holland Queensland workers in the construction of Mater Private Hospital Springfield Stage 2 ‚Äì a major expansion of Mater's existing hospital that will provide an extra 174 public beds for the community. Leticia, a student at Springfield's Good Shepherd Catholic Primary School, said she had a very good reason for choosing the name. "The reason why I named it Dr Crane is because doctors help people ‚Äì and the crane is helping build the hospital that will help people," she said. Mater Private Hospital Springfield Acting General Manager Billy Jovanovic said children at five Springfield primary schools had entered the 'Name the Crane' competition, as well as a colouring competition. "Leticia's suggested name for our new crane really stood out and definitely made the judges smile," Ms Jovanovic said. "I don't think there could be a better name for a hospital crane than Doctor Crane!" A second crane at the new hospital has been named Galu ‚Äì an Indigenous name for a crane bird ‚Äì following a separate competition open to nearby Aveo residents and Mater staff. The winning suggestion was made by hospital staff members Shiny John and Nadia Wilson. Mater Hospital Springfield is being built through a partnership between the State Government and Mater and will deliver Springfield's first public emergency department, intensive care unit and comprehensive maternity and birthing services. The new hospital will employ more than 1000 people when it becomes operational in 2026. Pictured: Leticia Salas with Mater Private Hospital Springfield Acting General Manager Billy Jovanovic and John Holland Queensland Construction Manager Matt Abel. [here](/crane-name-raises-smiles-at-new-mater-hospital-1152342/).

author: Forbes Staff
title: Concluye huelga en Notimex tras pago de indemnizaciones
text:
Los trabajadores de la extinta Notimex concluyeron el viernes la huelga que manten√≠an desde febrero de 2020 luego de que el Gobierno cumpliera con el pago de indemnizaciones a los trabajadores del Sindicato √önico de Trabajadores de la agencia de noticias del Estado.
En un comunicado, la Secretar√≠a de Trabajo y Previsi√≥n Social (STPS) inform√≥ que ayer hizo el pago de las indemnizaciones ‚Äúen cumplimiento al Convenio de Terminaci√≥n de las Relaciones Colectivas de Trabajo acordado entre el Gobierno de M√©xico y la organizaci√≥n gremial‚Äù.
Se√±al√≥ que en cumplimiento a las instrucciones del presidente Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador se realiz√≥ el pago correspondiente ‚Äúcon pleno respeto a los derechos laborales de la organizaci√≥n sindical, de acuerdo con la Ley Federal del Trabajo‚Äù.
Esto, abund√≥, deriva de la mesa de trabajo que se sostuvo estos d√≠as en las instalaciones de la Junta Federal con representantes de las secretar√≠as de Gobernaci√≥n, del Trabajo, del INDEP, de Notimex y el Sutnotimex (Sindicato √önico de Trabajadores de Notimex), donde se aprob√≥ y suscribi√≥ la versi√≥n final del convenio.
‚ÄúLleg√≥ el momento menos esperado para quienes trabajamos en la agencia de noticias del Estado mexicano que es el cierre definitivo‚Äù, se√±al√≥ en un breve mensaje a medios la secretaria general del Sutnotimex, Adriana Urrea.
‚ÄòCierre de Notimex por mala gesti√≥n‚Äô
Aclar√≥ que no fueron los trabajadores quienes decidieron cerrar Notimex, sino que fue la ‚Äúmala gesti√≥n‚Äù la que decidi√≥ no mantener este medio de comunicaci√≥n pues se argument√≥ que podr√≠a sustituirse con uno nuevo y que exist√≠a corrupci√≥n y falta de profesionalismo en los trabajadores.
‚ÄúHoy se baja el tel√≥n, se baja la cortina, se apagan las computadoras y se tapan los lentes de las c√°maras de Notimex, ya no se escuchar√° m√°s en los medios, en las salas de prensa, en las noticias informaci√≥n de Notimex‚Äù, dijo entre l√°grimas Urrea.
Indic√≥ que con ello se cierra un cap√≠tulo en la historia del periodismo de M√©xico y el mundo y se termina con la fuente laboral de m√°s de un centenar de trabajadores ‚Äúque lucharon, que dieron su vida por su fuente de empleo y que hoy fueron liquidados luego de 1,408 d√≠as de huelga‚Äù.
En octubre, el Gobierno a trav√©s de las secretar√≠as de Gobernaci√≥n y del Trabajo, firmaron un acuerdo con el Sutnotimex en el que acordaron la decisi√≥n de desaparecer Notimex, agencia creada con motivo de los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos en M√©xico en 1968.
Lee:
C√°mara de Diputados aprueba desaparici√≥n de Notimex
Inicio del conflicto en Notimex
El conflicto laboral en la agencia de noticias comenz√≥ en febrero de 2020 por el posible despido injustificado de al menos 200 colaboradores, principalmente mujeres, lo cual fue reprochado y defendido por el SutNotimex, sindicato que fue sustituido por la empresa a la llegada de su nueva directora, Sanjuana Mart√≠nez.
En distintas ocasiones, el presidente L√≥pez Obrador defendi√≥ el cierre de Notimex tras m√°s de tres a√±os del conflicto laboral que se inici√≥ durante su Gobierno.
‚ÄúSe est√° buscando un acuerdo porque nosotros no necesitamos una agencia de noticias en el Gobierno, eso era de la √©poca de los boletines y de la prensa oficial y oficiosa, ya no hay eso‚Äù, manifest√≥ varias veces desde el inicio del conflicto.
Con informaci√≥n de EFE
S√≠guenos en Google Noticias para mantenerte siempre informado

author: Raphael Gutzwiller
title: EM 2025: Nati-Verteidigerin Luana B√ºhler im Interview
text:
EM 2025
¬´Es tut sehr weh¬ª: Sie w√§re die Abwehrchefin gewesen, dann wurde Luana B√ºhler verletzt aus dem Kader gestrichen
Eigentlich ist sie die Schweizer Abwehrchefin, doch von Nati-Trainerin Pia Sundhage wurde sie angeschlagen aussortiert. Im Interview spricht Luana B√ºhler √ºber ihren Gesundheitszustand, die Rolle als Zuschauerin und die Schweizer Chancen gegen Spanien.

author: Elise Do Marcolino
title: Orages en r√©gion¬†: une forte activit√© √©lectrique ce soir dans l‚ÄôH√©rault et dans le Gard, de la pluie annonc√©e
text:
Orages en r√©gion : une forte activit√© √©lectrique ce soir dans l‚ÄôH√©rault et dans le Gard, de la pluie annonc√©e jusqu‚Äô√† demain
Ce 13 d√©cembre 2024, des orages √©clatent sur le littoral occitan. Dans le Gard et dans l‚ÄôH√©rault, on constate une forte activit√© √©lectrique.
Le ciel gronde ce soir dans le Gard et l‚ÄôH√©rault. Si le week-end s‚Äôannonce ensoleill√©, il faudra attendre que cette vague pluvio-orageuse passe.
"Les cumuls sont h√©t√©rog√®nes mais globalement revus √† la hausse avec souvent 15 √† 20 mm sur de vastes zones des plaines de l‚ÄôH√©rault et du Gard, ponctuellement 30 mm en limite de l‚ÄôEst H√©rault et de l‚Äôouest du Gard", note [M√©t√©o Languedoc](https://www.meteolanguedoc.com/actualites/pluies-et-chutes-de-neige-ce-vendredi-13-decembre).
H√©rault : orages en mer
Pour le moment, les orages restent √©loign√©s des terres. [M√©t√©o France](https://meteofrance.com/previsions-meteo-france/herault/34) signale la pr√©sence d‚Äôintemp√©ries au plus proche du littoral. Dans les prochaines heures, cette activit√© √©lectrique pourrait remonter jusqu‚Äô√† Montpellier ou Lunel, sans atteindre l‚Äôint√©rieur des terres.
La pluie qui s‚Äôest abattue toute la journ√©e sur le d√©partement continuera encore quelques heures, avant de cesser en d√©but de journ√©e samedi. Le week-end ensoleill√©, comme promis, arrivera bel et bien.
Gard : une nuit de forte activit√© √©lectrique
Du c√¥t√© du Gard, des orages sont signal√©s plus √† l‚Äôint√©rieur des terres. Aigues-Mortes, Sommi√®re, N√Æmes, Saint-Geni√®s-de-Malgoir√®s et Uz√®s, verront le ciel gronder ce soir.
√Ä cela s‚Äôajoutent des pluies persistantes dans l‚Äôensemble du d√©partement, qui cette fois encore, devraient prendre fin samedi matin. Il faudra faire attention sur les routes d√®s la fin de la nuit. Un brouillard, parfois √©pais, risque d‚Äôappara√Ætre.

author: Johan Sebasti√°n G√≥mez Rojas
title: Ciclistas en Bogot√° recibir√°n elementos de protecci√≥n GRATIS: fechas y d√≥nde se reclaman
text: Ciclistas en Bogot√° recibir√°n elementos de protecci√≥n gratis: fechas y d√≥nde se reclaman En el marco de la Semana de la Bici, la Administraci√≥n Distrital organizar√° jornadas pedag√≥gicas. Por: Johan Sebasti√°n G√≥mez Rojas Publicado: 19 de septiembre de 2024, 2:25 PM Actualizado: 19 de septiembre de 2024, 2:25 PM Ciclistas en Bogot√°. Foto: Colprensa Cada vez m√°s habitantes de Bogot√° optan por medios de transporte alternativos debido a las complicaciones en la movilidad, siendo la bicicleta una de las opciones m√°s destacadas por su rapidez y conveniencia para moverse por la ciudad. Por esta raz√≥n, durante la Semana de la Bici, los ciclistas tendr√°n la oportunidad de participar en diversas actividades y recibir premios. A partir del pr√≥ximo lunes 23 de septiembre, los ciclistas de Bogot√° tendr√°n la oportunidad de recibir elementos de protecci√≥n como parte de la programaci√≥n de la XVII Semana de la Bici. Esta iniciativa se enmarca dentro de una serie de actividades dise√±adas para promover la seguridad y el disfrute del uso de la bicicleta en la ciudad. Le puede interesar: [Festival Cordillera 2024 impulsa la econom√≠a en Bogot√°: gener√≥ millones en ingresos para la ciudad](https://www.rcnradio.com/bogota/festival-cordillera-2024-impulsa-la-economia-en-bogota-genero-millones-en-ingresos-para-la-ciudad) En el marco de la Semana de la Bici, que se celebrar√° entre el 23 y el 29 de septiembre, la Administraci√≥n Distrital organizar√° jornadas pedag√≥gicas en el occidente de Bogot√°. Durante estas jornadas, se distribuir√°n cascos, luces reflectivas y candados, elementos fundamentales para la protecci√≥n de los ciclistas en la v√≠a. Claudia D√≠az, secretaria de Movilidad de Bogot√°, destac√≥ la importancia de estas actividades: ‚ÄúEstamos comprometidos con la seguridad de los ciclistas y la promoci√≥n de la bicicleta como un medio de transporte seguro y eficiente. La entrega de estos elementos de protecci√≥n es una muestra m√°s de nuestro compromiso con la seguridad vial.‚Äù Adem√°s de la entrega de elementos de protecci√≥n, la Semana de la Bici contar√° con una serie de eventos que incluyen el foro acad√©mico ‚ÄòMi casa es cultura bici‚Äô y ciclopaseos a diversas zonas de la ciudad. Estos eventos buscan no solo educar a los ciclistas sobre la seguridad vial, sino tambi√©n celebrar y fortalecer la cultura de la bicicleta en Bogot√°. Lea tambi√©n: [El turismo en Colombia sigue creciendo y Bogot√° es uno de los principales motores](https://www.rcnradio.com/bogota/el-turismo-en-colombia-sigue-creciendo-y-bogota-es-uno-de-los-principales-motores) Los ciudadanos interesados en participar en estas actividades pueden consultar la agenda completa en la p√°gina web [www.movilidadbogota.gov.co.](https://www.movilidadbogota.gov.co/web/) La programaci√≥n incluye m√°s de 50 eventos gratuitos dirigidos a todos los p√∫blicos, con el objetivo de promover una movilidad m√°s segura y sostenible en la capital. Desde la Secretaria de Movilidad indican que, "el pr√≥ximo martes, 24 de septiembre, llevaremos a cabo una jornada pedag√≥gica de sensibilizaci√≥n, cuyo foco es el bienestar ciclista. Este d√≠a, en la Av. Guayacanes con calle 51 Sur y en la carrera 30 con calle 80, tendremos nuestra campa√±a Vidas Reflectivas donde el mensaje principal es hacernos ver en la v√≠a. All√≠ entregamos a los y los ciclistas elementos para hacerse visibles como chalecos, cintas reflectivas y luces. Asimismo, tendremos una entrega de candados ese mismo d√≠a en la cicloalameda El Porvenir, donde entregaremos y rifaremos estos elementos para parquear la bici de forma segura entre personas vulnerables". La Semana de la Bici se celebra anualmente como parte del Acuerdo Distrital 668 de 2017, en un esfuerzo conjunto entre la Administraci√≥n Distrital, la academia y diversos colectivos de la bicicleta.
